item.title: 法国在重要峰会前为摩根士丹利和其他投资机构赢得职位
item.description: 法国表示，摩根士丹利将在巴黎开设一个新的欧洲办事处，另有两家公司宣布了一项总价值达 7 亿欧元（7.538 亿美元）的投资，法国正准备主办一次重要的年度外国投资峰会。【原文：France said Morgan Stanley would open a new European office in Paris, while two other companies announced a combined investment worth 700 million euros ($753.8 million), as the country prepared to host a key annual foreign investment summit.】

item.title: 德国 Lilium 航空公司和瑞士公司将在法国开设新基地
item.description: 法国财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）周日表示，德国航空企业 Lilium 和瑞士镍精炼企业 KL1 将在法国建立新的生产基地，总投资额达 7 亿欧元（约合 7.5383 亿美元）。【原文：German aviation firm Lilium and Swiss-based nickel refinery company KL1 will set up new sites in France representing a combined investment of 700 million euros ($753.83 million), French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国工商银行发行 41.5 亿美元 TLAC 债券，拉开 TLAC 债券销售序幕
item.description: 中国工商银行表示，将于 5 月 15 日发行价值 300 亿元人民币（41.5 亿美元）的总损失吸收能力（TLAC）债券，这是中国银行首次发行此类债券。【原文：Industrial and Commercial Bank of China , said it would issue 30 billion yuan ($4.15 billion) worth of total loss-absorbing capacity (TLAC) bonds on May 15, marking the first issuance of such bonds by a Chinese bank.】

item.title: 韩国为芯片产业准备价值超过 70 亿美元的一揽子支持计划
item.description: 韩国财政部长周日表示，韩国正在为价值超过 10 万亿韩元（约合 73.0 亿美元）的芯片投资和研究一揽子支持计划做好准备，此前韩国已将目光投向了打赢一场半导体行业的 "战争"。【原文：South Korea is readying plans for a support package for chip investments and research worth more than 10 trillion won ($7.30 billion), the finance minister said on Sunday, after setting its sights on winning a "war" in the semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，苹果新泽西州专卖店工人投票反对成立工会
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六报道，苹果公司位于新泽西州肖特山的专卖店的工人投票反对成立工会。【原文：Workers at Apple's store in Short Hills, New Jersey, have voted against unionizing, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，Arm Holdings 计划在 2025 年推出人工智能芯片
item.description: 据《日经亚洲》周日报道，软银集团旗下的 Arm Holdings 公司计划开发人工智能芯片，力争在 2025 年推出首批产品。【原文：SoftBank Group's Arm Holdings , plans to develop artificial-intelligence chips, seeking to launch the first products in 2025, Nikkei Asia reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 市场：金融家担心私人信贷中的 "杠杆上的杠杆
item.description: 对聚集在洛杉矶参加米尔肯研究所会议的一些金融精英来说，私人市场上的债务狂潮让他们想起了 2008 年金融危机前冒险的狂欢岁月。【原文：To some elite financiers who gathered in Los Angeles for the Milken Institute conference, a debt binge in private markets is reminding them of the go-go days of risk-taking before the 2008 financial crisis.】

item.title: 中国碧桂园在宽限期内偿还在岸票据
item.description: 陷入困境的中国房地产开发商碧桂园周六发表声明称，继上周未偿还债券后，该公司已在五天宽限期到期前偿还了两笔在岸债券。【原文：Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden said in a statement on Saturday it had repaid two onshore bond coupons before the expiry of a five-day grace period, following missed payments last week.】

item.title: 中国公司赢得伊拉克油气田勘探许可证竞标
item.description: 周六，中国公司在一轮碳氢化合物勘探许可招标中中标勘探伊拉克的五个油气田，该轮招标的主要目的是提高天然气产量供国内使用。【原文：Chinese companies won bids to explore five Iraqi oil and gas fields on Saturday in a licensing round for hydrocarbon exploration that was primarily aimed at ramping up gas production for domestic use.】

item.title: 马斯克称卫星压力过大，"星链 "服务质量下降
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司的卫星部门 Starlink 的网站周六显示，该公司的服务正在下降，并补充说该团队正在调查这一问题。【原文：Starlink, the satellite unit of Elon Musk's SpaceX, is experiencing a degraded service, its website showed on Saturday, adding that the team is investigating the issue.】

item.title: 中国居民消费价格连续第三个月上涨，工厂通货紧缩依然存在
item.description: 4 月份，中国居民消费价格连续第三个月上涨，而生产者价格跌幅扩大，这表明尽管经济复苏不稳，但国内需求仍有韧性。【原文：China's consumer prices rose for a third straight month in April while producer prices extended their declines, suggesting resilient domestic demand despite a shaky economic recovery.】

item.title: 美国邮政局希望将大批量包裹运输的价格提高 25
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司周五表示，它正在寻求将大批量托运人通过其 "包裹选择"（Parcel Select）服务输入包裹进行地区递送的平均价格提高 25%。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service on Friday said it is seeking an average 25% price hike for high-volume shippers to enter packages for regional delivery through its Parcel Select service.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止信用卡逾期费上限为 8 美元的规定
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周五阻止了美国消费者金融保护局（Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）将信用卡逾期费上限设定为 8 美元的新规定，这对认为该机构越权的企业和银行业团体来说是一个胜利。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Friday blocked the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's new rule capping late fees on credit cards at $8, in a victor for business and banking groups which argued the agency exceeded its authority.】

item.title: 微软在美国Cortana专利诉讼案中被判赔2.42亿美元
item.description: 特拉华州的一个联邦陪审团周五裁定，微软的 Cortana 虚拟助手软件侵犯了 IPA 的一项专利，微软必须向专利所有人 IPA Technologies 支付 2.42 亿美元。【原文：Microsoft must pay patent owner IPA Technologies $242 million, a federal jury in Delaware said on Friday after determining that Microsoft's Cortana virtual-assistant software infringed an IPA patent.】

item.title: 美国财政部耶伦称国会应就非银行抵押贷款部门采取行动
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周五呼吁国会赋予监管机构更多权力，以监督日益增长的非银行抵押贷款行业，她说该行业给金融稳定带来了独特的风险。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Friday called for Congress to give regulators more power to oversee the growing nonbank mortgage industry, which she said presented unique risks to financial stability.】

item.title: 美国在气候谈判中讨论中国太阳能制造业 "产能过剩 "和煤炭问题
item.description: 美国国务院高级官员周五表示，在为期两天的气候变化问题双边会谈中，美国和中国讨论了中国在太阳能和电池制造、钢铁生产和煤炭发电方面的产能过剩问题。【原文：The United States and China discussed Chinese overcapacity in solar and battery manufacturing, steel production and coal power during two days of bilateral meetings on climate change, senior State Department officials said on Friday.】

item.title: 量化投资先驱吉姆-西蒙斯（Jim Simons）逝世，享年 86 岁
item.description: 西蒙斯基金会（Simons Foundation）周五表示，帮助推广量化投资的数学教授、金融家吉姆-西蒙斯（Jim Simons）去世，享年 86 岁。【原文：Jim Simons, the math professor turned financier who helped popularize quantitative investing, has died aged 86, the Simons Foundation said on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，麦当劳将推出 5 美元套餐，以吸引顾客回流
item.description: 彭博新闻社周五援引一位熟知内情的人士的话报道称，麦当劳正准备在美国的餐厅推出 5 美元一餐的优惠活动，以吸引更多受到通胀打击的顾客回到其连锁店。【原文：McDonald's is preparing to launch a $5 meal deal at its restaurants in the U.S. to lure back more inflation-hit customers to its chains, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克称特斯拉将斥资 5 亿美元扩建充电网络
item.description: 特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周五表示，特斯拉将斥资5亿多美元扩建其快速充电网络，几天前他突然解雇了负责该业务的员工。【原文：Tesla will spend more than $500 million to expand its fast-charging network, CEO Elon Musk said on Friday, days after abruptly laying off employees who were running the business.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，美国上市障碍重重，申银万国加紧伦敦上市准备工作
item.description: 两位知情人士称，在试图在纽约上市面临监管障碍和美国立法者的反对之后，快时尚巨头Shein正在加紧伦敦上市的准备工作。【原文：Fast-fashion giant Shein is stepping up preparations for a London listing after its attempt to float itself in New York faced regulatory hurdles and pushback from U.S. lawmakers, two people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 随着通胀预期跃升，美联储官员考虑利率是否足够高
item.description: 本周，美联储官员之间关于美国利率是否足够高的争论进一步加深，而在一项关键调查显示消费者的通胀预期出现跳升之后，这种争论可能会进一步加剧。【原文：Debate over whether U.S. interest rates are high enough deepened among Federal Reserve officials this week, and may be stoked further after a key survey showed a jump in consumers' inflation expectations.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士：拜登将对中国医疗用品征收关税
item.description: 据两位熟悉拜登政府决定的消息人士透露，拜登政府预计将在下周公布新的贸易战略时对中国制造的注射器和个人防护设备等医疗器械征收新的关税。【原文：The Biden administration is expected to issue new tariffs on Chinese-made medical devices like syringes and personal protective equipment when it unveils its new trade strategy next week, according to two sources familiar with the decision.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会寻求禁止对选举和灾难进行衍生品押注
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）主席表示，该委员会周五准备提议禁止用于押注美国大选和其他重大现实事件的上市衍生品。【原文：The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) on Friday was poised to propose a ban on listed derivatives used to bet on U.S. elections and other major real world events, its chair said.】

item.title: 巴西 4 月通胀略超预期，降息步伐放缓
item.description: 巴西官方数据周五显示，4月份巴西年度通胀率继续呈下降趋势，但略低于预期，这是在巴西央行投票决定降低利率步伐后的首次消费价格读数。【原文：Brazil's annual inflation continued to trend down but slightly less than expected in April, official data showed on Friday, in the first consumer price readings after the nation's central bank voted to reduce the pace of its interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 公司在与以色列数据挖掘公司的诉讼中败诉
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司指控一家以色列数据抓取公司非法复制和出售社交媒体平台上的内容，并出售允许他人复制和出售内容的工具，美国法官驳回了该公司的诉讼。【原文：A U.S. judge dismissed a lawsuit in which Elon Musk's X Corp accused an Israeli data-scraping company of illegally copying and selling content, and selling tools that let others copy and sell content, from the social media platform.】

item.title: 美联储主席洛根称美国货币政策可能不够紧缩
item.description: 达拉斯联储主席洛里-罗根（Lorie Logan）周五表示，目前还不清楚货币政策是否足够紧缩，以将通胀率降至美国央行设定的2%的目标，现在降息还为时过早。【原文：Dallas Federal Reserve President Lorie Logan on Friday said it's not clear if monetary policy is tight enough to bring inflation down to the U.S. central bank's 2% goal, and it is too soon to be cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国 5 月消费者信心指数降至六个月低点
item.description: 周五的一项调查显示，由于对通胀、失业和利率的担忧日益加剧，5月份美国消费者情绪降至六个月来的最低点。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment sagged to a six-month low in May amid growing anxiety about inflation, unemployment and interest rates, a survey showed on Friday.】

item.title: 降息希望重燃，美国股票基金周流入量增加
item.description: 截至 5 月 8 日的七天内，美国股票基金六周来首次出现单周资金流入，这要归功于一份低于预期的薪资报告，该报告重燃了美联储今年降息的希望。【原文：U.S. equity funds registered their first weekly inflow in six weeks in the seven days to May 8 thanks to a softer than anticipated payrolls report that revived hopes that the Federal Reserve would trim interest rates this year.】

item.title: 降息押注上升，全球股票基金吸引大量资金流入
item.description: 截至 5 月 8 日的七天内，全球股票基金的需求急剧上升，原因是美国就业报告比预期疲软后，市场对美联储降息的押注再次升温。【原文：Demand for global equity funds rose sharply in the seven days to May 8, driven by renewed bets on Federal Reserve interest rate cuts after a softer than anticipated U.S. employment report.】

item.title: 加拿大就业岗位增幅超出预期，抑制了对 6 月降息的押注
item.description: 周五的数据显示，加拿大经济4月份新增就业人数是预测值的五倍，失业率意外保持在6.1%，这抑制了市场对6月份降息的押注。【原文：Canada's economy added five times the number of jobs that were forecast for April and the unemployment rate unexpectedly held at 6.1%, data showed on Friday, dampening market bets for a June rate cut.】
